name: Faith Hill
religion: Faith Hill is a devout Baptist.
politicalViews: She is a strong supporter of the Democratic party.
author: Caitlin Frye

content.text: Faith Hill was born in Ridgeland, Mississippi and raised in Star, Mississippi.
With a first name like Faith, it's no surprise that she was raised in a devout Baptist family. Hill even got her start singing in church, though not always for her own congregation.

content.sourceTitle: Faith Hill on music, junk food and poetry.
content.text: The music that inspired me early on was the music I heard in church. I was brought up in a Baptist church, but when I was a teenager I sang in black churches, Pentecostal, and I'm really inspired by that music.
She's clearly still a devout Christian. When talking about how her religion is a huge part of her life, Hill said,

That's where my strength comes from. It's my foundation. I was raised in a Christian home and it prepared me to deal with life on my own . . . Having a backbone of spirituality makes me a little stronger. I pray a lot, and when I first moved to Nashville, that's what kept me alive. I believed I was being taken care of. I apply it to my life every day. It's how I've always looked at things.
Her lyrics often reflect her spirituality, although she doesn't have too big a hand in the actual writing of her songs.
Whoever is generous to the poor lends to the Lord

Hill obviously takes the Bible's many references to helping the needy seriously. The list of charities she's been involved with is impressive, to say the least. Hill and her husband, country musician Tim McGraw, established a foundation to fund local charities that provide health and educational services.

content.sourceTitle: Tim McGraw and Faith Hill Donate $1 Million to Benefit Displaced Children from Hurricane Katrina.
content.text: They donated $1 million to benefit children displaced by Hurricane Katrina in 2005

content.sourceTitle: Faith Hill's Charity Work, Events, and Causes.
content.text: and they gave $375,000 to the Navy-Marine Corps Relief Society to help families affected by the terrorist attack on the USS Cole in 2000.
And that's just a few of them.

content.sourceTitle: Faith Hill's federal campaign contribution report.
content.text: Hill isn't too tight with her money when it comes to political campaigns either. She gave $5,000 to Barack Obama's 2008 presidential campaign.

content.sourceTitle: Faith Hill to help celebrate Obama's inauguration.
content.text: She showed her support for the Democrat after his election by performing at his inaugural celebration.
She hasn't waxed poetic on all her reasons for being a Democrat, but her husband made it clear that he and his wife stand with the president.

content.sourceTitle: The Two Sides of Tim McGraw.
content.text: My wife and I and our family will do everything we can to support Obama.

content.sourceTitle: Chely Wright Talks Being A Lesbian In Country Music, LikeMe Lighthouse And Celebrity Support.
content.text: Perhaps in fear of alienating some of her fan base, Hill hasn't come out in support of gay marriage. Yet. She did, however, privately support a fellow country musician who came out as a lesbian in 2010.
But maybe now that support of gay marriage is part of the Democratic platform, she'll jump on board in front of the rest of the nation and her fans.
